contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Use British English|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> Name = You Win Again | Type = studio | Artist = [[Van Morrison]] | Cover = You Win Again (album cover).jpg | Released = 3 October 2000 | Recorded = 2000<br>The Wool Hall, Bath, England | Genre = [[Rock (music)|Rock]], [[Country Music|Country]], [[Country rock]]| Length = 42:00 | Label = [[Virgin records|Virgin]] | Producer = [[Van Morrison]] | Last album = ''[[The Skiffle Sessions - Live In Belfast 1998]]''<br/>(2000) | This album = ''You Win Again''<br/>(2000) | Next album = ''[[Down the Road (Van Morrison album)|Down the Road]]''<br/>(2002) | Misc = {{Singles | Name =You Win Again | Type =studio | Single 1 =Let's Talk About Us" b/w "[[Singing the Blues]]"/"The Ballad of Jesse James | Single 1 date =September 2000 | Single 2 = | Single 2 date = | Single 3 = | Single 3 date = | Single 4 = | Single 4 date = }} }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|3|5}} <ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r500756|first=Stephen Thomas|last=Erlewine}}</ref> | rev2 = ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' | rev2Score = B+ <ref>[http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,277884,00.html ''Entertainment Weekly'' review]</ref> | rev3 = ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' | rev3Score = {{Rating|3|5}} <ref>[http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/67/albums/album/316684/rid/5946175/ ''Rolling Stone'' review]</ref> | rev4 = | rev4Score = }} '''''You Win Again''''' is the twenty-eighth [[studio album]] by [[Northern Ireland|Northern Irish]] [[singer-songwriter]] [[Van Morrison]]. It is a duet album with [[Linda Gail Lewis]] that was released in 2000 (see [[2000 in music]]) by [[Virgin Records]]. The album was recorded at The Wool Hall, [[Bath, Somerset|Bath]], [[England]]. ==Track listing== #"Let's Talk About Us" ([[Otis Blackwell]]) – 2:53 #"[[You Win Again (Hank Williams song)|You Win Again]]" ([[Hank Williams]]) – 3:01 #"[[Jambalaya (On the Bayou)]]" (Williams) – 2:57 #"[[Crazy Arms]]" (Ralph Mooney, Chuck Seals) – 3:37 #"Old Black Joe" ([[Stephen Foster; (as performed by Jerry Lee Lewis)]]) – 3:21 #"Think Twice Before You Go" (Al Smith) – 2:38 #"No Way Pedro" (Van Morrison) – 3:44 #"[[A Shot of Rhythm and Blues|Shot of Rhythm and Blues]]" (Terry Thompson) – 3:59 #"Real Gone Lover" ([[Dave Bartholomew]], Ruth Durand, [[Joseph Robichaux]]) – 3:09 #"[[Why Don't You Love Me|Why Don't You Love Me (Like You Used to Do)?"]] (Williams) – 2:23 #"[[Cadillac (song)|Cadillac]]" ([[Bo Diddley|Ellas McDaniel]]) – 2:33 #"[[Baby (You've Got What It Takes)]]" ([[Clyde Otis]], Murray Stein, [[Brook Benton]]) – 3:45 #"[[Boogie Chillen]]" ([[John Lee Hooker]]) – 4:00 <ref>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_Black_Joe</ref> ==Personnel== *[[Van Morrison]] - [[singing|vocals]], [[Steel-string guitar|acoustic]] and [[electric guitar]]s, [[harmonica]] *[[Linda Gail Lewis]] - vocal, [[piano]] *Ned Edwards - electric guitar, [[mandolin]], [[backing vocalist|background vocals]] *Paul Godden - [[steel guitar]] *Lee Goodall - [[saxophone]] *Pete Hurley - [[bass guitar|bass]] *Colin Griffin - [[drum kit|drums]] ==Charts== '''Album''' - [[UK Album Chart]] (United Kingdom) {| border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2 width="250px" !align="left"|Year !align="left"|Chart !align="left"|Position |- |align="left"|2000 |align="left"|UK Album Chart |align="left"|34 |- |} '''Album''' - [[Billboard magazine|Billboard]] (North America) {| border=1 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=2 width="250px" |align="left"|Year |align="left"|Chart |align="left"|Position |- |align="left"|2000 |align="left"|The Billboard 200 |align="left"|161 |- |} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Van Morrison}} [[Category:Van Morrison albums]] [[Category:2000 albums]] [[Category:Virgin Records albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Van Morrison]]
